properties.title: Pleasure Craft Revenge, Carrington Point, Santa Rosa Island, CA
properties.description: On the afternoon of 10-JUNE-2012, USCG Marine Safety Detachment Santa Barbara contacted their NOAA SSC about the vessel REVENGE that had sunk just off Carrington Point on Santa Rosa Island, CA. The REVENGE is a 40' pleasure craft with 250 gallons of diesel on board. She is not leaking at present and salvage/removal operations will commence on the morning of 11-JUNE-2012. USCG requested a precautionary "what if" trajectory estimate from NOAA ERD in the event the vessel leaks overnight or before salvage operations are completed.View Full Report

properties.title: NRC Report: Industrial Wastewater With Petroleum in Ditch near Colorado Springs, CO
properties.description: Report DetailsNRC Report ID: 1013965Incident Time: 2012-06-06 00:00:00Nearest City: Colorado Springs, COLocation: INDUSTRIAL SEWER MANHOLEIncident Type: FIXEDMaterial: INDUSTRIAL WASTEWATER WITH PETROLEUMMedium Affected: WATERSuspected Responsible Party: FT. CARSON ARMY BASESkyTruth AnalysisLat/Long: 38.695938, -104.765242 (Approximated from ZIP)Reported Spill Volume: 10000 gallonsReport Description****WEB REPORT**** HEAVY RAINS CAUSED INDUSTRIAL SEWER TO OVERFLOW FROM A MANHOLE LOCATED DOWNGRADIENT OF THE PRETREATMENT SYSTEM. THE DISCHARGE FLOWED 100 FEET OVERLAND THEN INTO A DITCH CONTAINING WATER THAT DISCHARGES TO FOUNTAIN CREEK, APPROXIMATELY ONE MILE AWAY. THE DISCHARGE WAS PRIMARILY STORMWATER AND WASTEWATER FROM MAINTENANCE OPERATIONS BUT MAY HAVE CONTAINED SOME PETROLEUM. SOME OF THE OVERFLOW ALSO DISCHARGED INTO A DIVERSION POND.View Full Report
properties.summary: Incident Type: FIXED - NRC Report ID: 1013965 - Medium Affected: WATER - Suspected Responsible Party: FT. CARSON ARMY BASE
